thread.title: Houston's traffic is terrible, but it's far from the worst in America
thread.title_full: Houston's traffic is terrible, but it's far from the worst in America - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: Houston's traffic is terrible, but it's far from the worst in America
text:
Driving bumper to bumper in Houston can make it easy to feel hatred toward what seems like an endless, tangled mess of concrete.
But the freeways aren't always grayer and less congested on the other side.
INRIX , a traffic information company, recently conducted a study which graded cities based off their level of traffic congestion.
RANKED: The healthiest cities in Texas
Researchers looked at more than 1,000 cities in 38 countries to gather the data.
While New York City has long been seen as the traffic jam hub of the US, a new city had emerged as the worst congested city on the face of the Earth for rush hour traffic: Los Angeles, California. Los Angelenos spend an average of 104 hours in congested traffic a week, according to Inrix, a transportation analytics firm. This number tops Moscow at 91, and in third place, New York City at 89 total congested traffic hours.
Media: Brandpoint While Houston isn't ranked particularly well on the list; at least it's not among the worst of the worst.
Looking at these ratings and knowing that there are a host of cities (we're looking at you Dallas) with commuters more miserable than Houstonians might feel therapeutic.
The Bayou City saw similar results on a recent ranking from TomTom , which noted that Houstonians actually spent slightly less time in congestion than 2015. Dug Begley delved into why in this piece on HoustonChronicle.com .
STAYING DRY: Houston streets that are prone to flooding, high water
Click through above to see which cities have the most congestion issues.
Photo: Victor Decolongon, Getty Image 1 of / 26 Caption
